text: SUFONAMA is a joint study programme which awards a double degree, fully recognized in all the participating countries, upon graduation. To obtain the SUFONAMA double degree, you must

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You will start your studies at the University of Copenhagen (UCPH) together with all other SUFONAMA students.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: For the second year of studies, you and the other SUFONAMA students will travel to your second-year university according to your chosen mobility track:

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You have been informed which second-year university you will go to in your letter with offer of admission to the programme. Your mobility track is binding and cannot be changed.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Getting a double degree means that you receive two national degrees – one degree from each university where you’ve completed 60 ECTS.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: To graduate and obtain the double degree you must complete 120 ECTS in total (60 ECTS at two different SUFONAMA universities):

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: To obtain a diploma from both two universities you’ve attended, you need to transfer credits from

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You’ll need a certified transcript of records from each of the partner universities on your mobility track, which shows all the courses and grades, to start the process of a credit transfer. It is your own responsibility to get the transcript of records and to start the credit transfer.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: In this handbook we will also explain, how you transfer credits.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The academic calendars and the time of your study start vary amongst the SUFONAMA universities.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Here you’ll find an approximate academic calendar for all SUFONAMA universities.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Your academic performance is evaluated with national grades at each university. The grades are related to the ECTS grading scale in the table below.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Please note that no official conversion table exists. The table is constructed based on the practices of the involved universities, so this cannot be used as an official conversion table but an indication of conversion.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: As an Erasmus Mundus Scholarship holder, you must be enrolled and a full-time student to be eligible for the scholarship. In case of interruption of enrolment, e.g. maternity leave, sick leave or similar absence, you must inform the SUFONAMA office at UCPH (sufonama@science.ku.dk). Your scholarship will then be stopped for your period of absence and started again upon your return to your studies.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The maximum duration of the scholarship is 24 months (33,600€ in total). If you extend your studies beyond 24 months, the scholarship cannot be extended.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Throughout your studies the SUFONAMA office at UCPH will transfer your monthly scholarship of 1400€ to your preferred bank account.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Your residential address is the determining factor in whether the scholarship instalment is transferred in DKK (Danish Kroner) or in Euros.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You are responsible for the charge of fees for the transfer if your account is in another currency.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The scholarship is always paid in advance for the forthcoming month and will be at your disposal on the last bank day of a given month. For example: the instalment for November is paid on the last bank day of October.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The last possible scholarship instalment will be available on the last bank day of July for the month of August of the second year of study.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The first instalment of the scholarship is prepaid for 3 months and to disposal no later than the end of September.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: To receive the first instalment, you must

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: We will contact you in June before study start with further information on the process.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You must inform us of the bank account where you wish to receive the scholarship.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: In June before study start, we will contact you and ask you to submit a bank form with the relevant information on your bank account for the first instalment.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: For the rest of the first year in Copenhagen, you must assign and activate a NemKonto, to get your monthly allowance of the scholarship. We will contact you in July before study start with further information.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can read about NemKonto here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Before you move to the country of your second-year university we will contact you again and request information on which bank account you’ll use during your second year of studies. You must send us an updated bank form with your new address and tax identification number.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Maybe you can find the answer on theSUFONAMA scholarship page– otherwise contactsufonama@science.ku.dk.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Students required to pay tuition fee will be contacted by the SUFONAMA office 2-4 weeks before the deadline for paying tuition fee. Tuition fee is collected for each semester of the programme.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Didn’t find what you were looking for?

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Maybe you can find the answer on theSUFONAMA tuition fee page– otherwise contactsufonama@science.ku.dk.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The Erasmus Mobility Grant is administered by UCPH. You can apply for the Erasmus Mobility Grant if you

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You cannot apply for the grant if you are going to Bangor University on your second year, as the United Kingdom is no longer apart of the Erasmus Mobility Scheme.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can read more about Erasmus Mobility Grant on UCPH Study Information.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You apply for the Erasmus Mobility Grant through the application portal Mobility Online.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The deadline is1 November at 12.00 (noon) CET.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Find a guide and Mobility Online on UCPH Study Information.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You’ll receive a preapproval of your second-year courses

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: UCPH will send you a preapproval of your second-year courses in February/March. You will need this document for your Learning Agreement.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: SUFONAMA will provide you with insurance coverage for the two-year period of the programme in compliance with the Erasmus+ Requirements for Erasmus Mundus Joint Master’s.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You will be insured through Dr. Walter with PROTRIP-WORLD-PLUS, which includes health, liability and accident insurance. You are covered in all countries SUFONAMA is offered.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The insurance takes effect when you start your journey to the UCPH, but no earlier than two months before official study start on 1 September.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You will receive your Insurance Confirmation by July before study start.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Before starting your studies, we will send you a Student Agreement. The Student Agreement is an Erasmus Mundus specific contract between you and the programme. You must sign the Student Agreement and return it tosufonama@science.ku.dk.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Please read the Student Agreement carefully before signing and returning it.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: As a SUFONAMA student you can make use of the student services available at each partner university.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Before Arriving in Copenhagen (University of Copenhagen)

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: UCPH oversees the admission of all SUFONAMA students to the programme. As part of this process, you will be enrolled at UCPH, and you will stay enrolled at the university through your entire study period until you’ve graduated.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: This means that you can make use of all services for UCPH-students when you are a SUFONAMA student – even when you are studying at your second-year university.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can read about student life and services on UCPH Study Information.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: From the end of May, you will receive information emails from The Faculty of Science (SCIENCE) at UCPH. In the first email, you will get an invitation to the online study start course How to MSc.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Amongst other topics, the course introduces you to

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: How to MSc is a great tool for you to prepare yourself for the move to Copenhagen and getting acquainted with SUFONAMA.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: We encourage you to read How to MSc carefully and join the scheduled webinars.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Access How to MSc through your study start room ‘SUFONAMA 2024’ fromAbsalon.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Living in Copenhagen can be expensive, so it is important that you make a realistic budget. Many students in Copenhagen supplement their budget with a student job.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: We’ve made a rough estimate of the expected living costs in the city, both with a lower budget and a higher budget. It might be possible to live in the city on a smaller budget than what we’ve estimated.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Other sources with info on living costs in Copenhagen

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Copenhagen is the capital of Denmark, and life in the city is affected by that. It is a vibrant and cycle-friendly city with exciting career opportunities and a great student culture, with good job opportunities and endless cultural opportunities – and lastly it is a comfortable city to live in.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: As a SUFONAMA student you’ll need to find accommodation in the city. This can be a challenge, especially in July, August and September.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You need to be patient when looking for accommodation and make a plan for your apartment/room hunting.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: UCPH is collaborating with Housing Foundation, an independent organization that helps international students enrolled at the university with finding accommodation.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: All questions to for Housing Foundation should be directed tocontact@housingfoundation@ku.dk.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: At UCPH, you must register for your compulsory, restricted elective and elective courses prior to showing up in class.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can only register for courses in designated periods throughout the study year.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: For courses in block 1 and 2 in the autumn semester, you must register from mid-May to end-May. For courses in block 3 and 4 in the spring semester, you must register from mid-November to end-November.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Even though you must register for courses at UCPH, it might be different at your second-year university.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Useful info about course registration at UCPH

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: It is your own responsibility to

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: As an EU citizen, you must apply for a registration certificate after you arrive in Denmark, if you plan to stay in Denmark longer than 3 months.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: As a non-EU citizen you must apply for and obtain a Danish residence permit before you enter Denmark.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: SCIENCE will assist you in beginning the visa application to Denmark. You will be contacted in late May on your UCPH alumni email (KUmail) with more information.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: We encourage you to begin the visa application process as soon as possible.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Each SUFONAMA partner university oversees the local orientation and welcome days for new international students.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: On your first year of studies at UCPH, SCIENCE organise the study start and Welcome Days for all new master’s students to the faculty.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The study start at SCIENCE consists of two parts:

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The online study start is your study start course How to MSc.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Apart from getting a lot of useful information in the course, you can also join webinars about certain topics from May to August.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Access How to MSc on through you study start room ‘SUFONAMA 2024’ on Absalon.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: During the last week of August, the international Welcome Days take place for all new master’s students at the faculty.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: During the welcome days you can expect

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: We encourage you to participate in the welcome days in August to get acquainted with the university and the other students.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Here you’ll find the most common topics on practical matters when you study at UCPH. The topics are not exhaustive, but they can give you an indication of where you can find more information.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The academic year at SCIENCE is divided into four blocks of 15 ECTS credits. A block consists of

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can read about the academic year and holidays on UCPH Study Information.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: During your first year on SUFONAMA, you will be studying at the Department of Food and Resource Economics – the department is a part of the Faculty of Science (SCIENCE) and is located at Frederiksberg Campus.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: As a student at SCIENCE, you can make use of campus facilities available, join webinars and seminars hosted by SCIENCE Student Services on different relevant topics, like career, well-being and study techniques.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You will get information on the Danish language course in How to MSc in module 2 – Living and studying in Denmark. You can also register for the language course in How to MSc.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Learning some Danish can be very helpful when you live in Denmark, as it will help you with the practicalities of everyday life and even if you consider applying for a student job or working in Denmark after graduation.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: We encourage you to register for the language courses offered by UCPH.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: In these sections you can read more about topics that relate to courses and teaching while you study at UCPH.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: While you are studying at UCPH, you will experience different types of teaching. Amongst others you will experience:

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can always identify the teaching method for each course at UCPH when reading the course description.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Find your courses in the Course Catalogue.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Teaching in Denmark is characterised by an analytical approach. This means that you are expected to work independently, to discuss and form your own opinion on topics, as well as compare, analyse and critically assess information while you are studying at UCPH.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: In How to MSc you will get a deeper introduction to Danish educational culture – we encourage you read the section to prepare for the ways of teaching at the UCPH.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: None of the SUFONAMA partner universities tolerate plagiarism. It is a serious offence as the plagiarist takes credit for work that rightly belongs to someone else. In that sense it can be considered stealing.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: If you plagiarise it can have serious consequences for your further studies.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: It is important that you always refer in a clear and concise manner to the source you’ve used in your assignments. You can always reach out to your teacher or Head of Studies if you are unsure about how to cite sources correctly.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: On UCPH Study Information you can read about

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: During your first year on SUFONAMA, your courses will be graded with the Danish 7-point grading scale.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: To get a further explanation of the grading scale and assessment of exams at UCPH, please visitStudy Information on Grades and assessment.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: At UCPH it is custom to evaluate the courses you’ve taken after the end of each course. You will be contacted by email when it is time to evaluate the course.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Evaluating courses is a good way for you to let the course coordinator know about the quality of the course. All evaluations are anonymous.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The type of examination will vary from course to course during your first year of studies. All exams are regulated by the university.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: In addition, you can always identify the examination type for each course at UCPH by reading the course description.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Find your courses in the Course Catalogue.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can read more about examination and regulations on UCPH Study Information:

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Preparing for your Second Year of Studies

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Making Preparations for the Second Year

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: In the spring semester on your first year of studies, you can begin preparing for your second year of study. This is also when your second-year university will contact you regarding enrolment.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: This section will take you through what you need to know about preparing for your second year of study before you leave UCPH and Copenhagen.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You need a certified transcript of records from UCPH and apply for a credit transfer at your second-year university.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: We encourage you to order a certified transcript as soon as all your courses (60 ECTS) from UCPH have been graded – you will complete your last courses at UCPH by the end of June.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You must request a certified copy of your transcript from SCIENCE Student Services.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: This is what you must do:

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: 1. Go to the contact page ofSCIENCE Student Services

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: 4. Fill in the form (make sure to choose the English version of the form in the upper right corner)

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: 5. Your certified transcript will be sent to you when your request has been processed by the Study Administration.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Once you’ve received your certified transcript of records from UCPH, you must ensure that your credits are transferred to your second-year university.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Each university has different procedures for transferring credits. Below you can see how to transfer credits to each partner university.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: As a SUFONAMA student, you must complete an online application to credit transfer. It will be processed with the other international students and you will receive the same communications and assistance as for other international students. You can upload your transcripts to the application system. You will also need to upload all other relevant documents for your admission to be processed.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Your application is not being assessed for entry, but the site is a place to collate all your documentation and means you will receive guidance and support from our International Education Centre (IEC) staff.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can access the application portal here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You transfer your credits from University of Copenhagen to University of Göttingen by sending your certified transcript of records tosufonama@uni-goettingen.de.You can do this immediately after you’ve completed first year of study in Copenhagen or after the end of your second of study year in Göttingen.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You must send your certified transcript of records from University of Copenhagen tojointdegrees.tesaf@unipd.itto transfer credits from your first year of study to Unipd.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Before the transfer of credits, you must insert a study plan for the Forest Science Master programme into your Uniweb account. You will receive instructions upon arrival to Unipd.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: All credits obtained at UCPH will be recognized by Unipd as a part of your master’s programme. The grades will be transferred following the SUFONAMA joint grading scale. The courses will be registered with the weighted medium grade of all first-year courses.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: When you’ve started your second year at SLU, you must apply for a credit transfer of your courses from UCPH.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can read about how to credit transfer at SLU here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Before you arrive in Bangor you must register with Bangor University.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can read more on Welcome to Bangor University.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The cost of living in Bangor depends on your chosen accommodation and lifestyle.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: A broad estimate would be a minimum of £1,023 per month for a single student living in the Bangor area including accommodation. £1,023 is the UK government’s estimate for student living costs in the UK.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can read about living costs in Bangor here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: As a SUFONAMA student you will be guaranteed a place in university accommodation as all international students are guaranteed accommodation provided, they follow the conditions for guaranteed accommodation.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can read full terms and conditions for guaranteed accommodation here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can read about Bangor University accommodation and how to apply here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You confirm your module choice during registration to the university, which includes selecting restricted elective courses.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: As SUFONAMA student at Bangor you will do 120 credits in total, which includes a 60-credit Master’s thesis.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You must apply for aStudent Route Visabefore you travel to the UK both if you are a non-EU citizen and if you are an EU-citizen.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: If you are an EU, EEA or Switzerland citizen with UK pre-settled/settled status you do not need an additional visa.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can check if you need a visa to the UK here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The details of the Student Route Visa are:

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You will receive a visa vignette (sticker) in your passport and will collect your BRP (visa card) in Bangor, either at Bangor Post Office or at the University. If you collect your BRP on BU campus, please specify ACL location code 2HE592.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can read about visas on the Bangor University website.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You will be enrolled in Göttingen during the first year of your SUFONAMA studies in Copenhagen. We will issue your admission letter for your study stay at University of Göttingen, once we have received the application and admission documents from University of Copenhagen.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The admission letter contains further information about the enrollment process. You must accept the offer to study at University of Göttingen within two weeks by registering on the portal provided in the admissions letter. You will then receive an automated email from the university. You will also receive a separate letter which explains the SUFONAMA specific enrolment procedure.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: How each individual budgets their living costs depends on their personal needs and preferences. As Göttingen is a typical student town, the price level is comparatively low. The Göttingen Student’s Association, called “Studentenwerk”, provides a good and affordable basic infrastructure with numerous dormitories, cafeterias and dining facilities. Many of the cultural and sports facilities and public transport services also give student discounts and the "Semesterticket" allows further savings.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: To cover the cost of living in Göttingen, you currently need at least 850 to 950 € a month.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can read about finances during your studies in Göttingen here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: In Germany, students usually arrange their own accommodation. The options are

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Many international students live in student dorms. Most dorms are run by the Studentenwerk, an independent non-profit organisation closely collaborating with the university. The Studentenwerk offers a limited number of rooms for double degree and Erasmus Mundus students at the University of Göttingen.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: As a SUFONAMA student, you can apply directly for a room in a student dormitory withthe Accommodation Service.Youcannot apply for housing directly to the Studentenwerk.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: eCampusis the central access point for all online services of the university. In eCampus you can

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You will receive your access data for the eCampus portal when youapply for your student ID card.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can apply for a student ID card here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: FlexNowis the electronic administration programme for examinations at the University of Göttingen. With your e-campus account, you will also get access to FlexNow.You will receive your access data for the eCampus portal when youapply for your student ID card.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You must register in person at the Residents’ Registration Office (Einwohnermeldamt) within 14 days of your arrival to Göttingen. This is required by law. You will need to make an appointment to register.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can make you appointment online on the website of the City of Göttingen (in German).

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: If you are living in a student residence hall run by Studentenwerk, the Wohnungsgeberbestätigung will be given to you by the residence hall administration.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: For all other types of rental accommodation, you will receive this document from the person renting the room to you.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: International students from EU/EEA countries do not need a visa nor a residence permit to stay in Göttingen for their studies.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You must still register with the Residents’ Registration Office as described above.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: International students from non-EU/EEA countries must apply for a residence permit no later than 90 days after entry in Germany. The application is submitted to the Immigration Office (Ausländerbehörde).

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can read about visas and residence permit for international students here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You will be enrolled at the University of Padua (Unipd) before your arrival in Padua and you will stay enrolled throughout your entire study period, until you have graduated.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The Mobility Unit (part of the Projects and Mobility Office of Unipd) will send you an email when it’s time to start organising your stay in Padua. In the email you will receive an “Information sheet” and the link to the section of our website where you can find all the info for double degree students that you need.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can read about procedure for incoming students of International Joint Programmes here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Please make sure to explore all the webpages dedicated to double degree students, including the sections dedicated to each stage of your mobility (Before, During, etc.), the UniverCity life section, and the list of Services available in the grey box at the bottom of each webpage.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The Mobility Unit will take care of your registration and enrolment and will ask you to fill out an application form and submit

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: We’vemade a rough estimate of the expected living costs, and as you can see in the table below, you will needapproximately €800-900a month to cover living expenses in Padua.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The Mobility Unit of the University of Padua has an agreement with the Regional Agency for the Right to University Education (ESU) and manages a limited number of reserved places for incoming students in the University residence halls.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: All SUFONAMA students(except Italian citizens resident in Italy) will receive an email from the Mobility Unit with an invitation to fill out an Accommodation Form to request a place in the dorms.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Non-EU citizens applications will be favoured, and the places may not be sufficient to host all the incoming SUFONAMA students, nonetheless the Mobility Unit at Unipd will do all that is possible and will provide you with

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can read about accommodation for joint/double degrees here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: We don’t have course registration at Unipd, but you will have to sign up for each course unit on our e-learning platform, Moodle, and you will have to create a study plan on our student platform Uniweb.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You will receive detailed information about all this and how courses work at Unipd during our online Welcome Days in mid-September.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can read about course organisation and university life at Unipd in the UniverCity life section here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: If you are a non-EU citizen¸ you will get a Danish residence permit. With that permit you can stay in Padua for 360 days maximum without needing to apply for an Italian permit.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: For stays longer than 360 days you can either

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: We will give you the most updated info around 3 months before your arrival in Padua.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: If you are an EU citizen, you don’t need to do anything; you can stay in Padua without any type of registration for your SUFONAMA studies.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: As a SUFONAMA student at SLU, you will have thestudent status of an exchange student. This is important to keep in mind when readingdifferent information givenatforexamplethe SLU website, as different rules and routinesappliesto differentstudent categories.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Sweden isa relatively expensivecountry. Youneed a minimum of SEK 9,450 per month to cover your living costs.Study in Swedenprovidesgood informationabout the cost of living and the average student budget.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Alnarp student housing offers approximately 200 different types of accommodation, most of which are in Alnarp. Accommodation includes shared student housing, the Greenhouse hall of residence in Malmö, and a small housing unit on the outskirts of Lomma.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: SLU mainly offer shared student housing, where students have a private room and share a kitchen and bathrooms with other residents. The size, standard, and price of these rooms vary. Some accommodation has been reserved by various departments, meaning that certain student groups, visiting research fellows and others are given priority.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can read more about SLU Student Housing here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can apply for accommodation in Alnarp through SLU, as SLU offers student accommodation to exchange students depending on availability. You must apply for housing in time.  Please note, that you are not guaranteed housing.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Questions regarding housing should be sent tohousing@slu.se

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You find the application form for student housing here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Before you can register for courses at SLU, you must be registered at SLU by applying to become an exchange student at the university. Below you can see the necessary steps to become an exchange student at SLU and how to register for courses.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Step 1:The SUFONAMA administrative officer at SLU, will inform the SLU Mobility that you are coming to SLU for your second year of studies within the SUFONAMA program. The SLU Mobility Team will handle your application for exchange study at SLU.Step 2: Once the SLU Mobility team is informed, they will contact you with instructions on how to apply to SLU as an exchange student. You must fill in the online application for exchange studies, when you receive it.Step 3:After submitting your application for exchange, you will receive a link to apply for the courses. When you apply for courses, you must upload your Transcript of Records. Your transcript should include all courses you have taken at university-level. You must also upload a list of any courses NOT listed in your transcript, but which you will have passed by the time you start courses at SLU.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You will receive an acceptance letter via email in May/beginning of June for studies at SLU the whole year, but you can only apply and be accepted for courses one semester at a time. You apply for courses for the Spring Semester in September/October.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: There are various ways to get to Alnarp Campus at SLU.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: By trainThe closest train station is in Åkarp, 2 km from AlnarpYou can useSkånetrafikento plan your trip (In Swedish only, use the translator in your browser).

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can select the subject for the dissertation from a list of suggested topics or you can develop a topic yourself. However, the research project must be approved by us as being suitable and relevant to the MSc programme. The choice of dissertation topic is usually related to the specific interests of the individual. You will receive further information on the dissertation when relevant.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Typically, a student would have 2-3 months for data collection from the field, laboratory or computer; and 1-2 months for data analysis. There would follow 1-2 months for writing-up, including correction of the first draft after the comments of the supervisor are received. The pass mark is 50%, 60% would be ‘good’ and 70% ‘excellent’.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: A resource that you might find useful is theStudy Skills Centre, which can help you understand  assignments, academic reading and writing. It also provides other helpful tips.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: For help with your writing skills,you can refer to resources available through the Study Skills Centre.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The most serious academic offence is plagiarism.  It is the equivalent of stealing someone’s work and fraudulently pretending that it is your own in order to gain higher marks than you deserve.  Copying, word for word, large sections of writing from any source (e.g.paper, book, web pages, other students’ work, etc.) without acknowledgement of the author or owner is plagiarism because it is wrongly claiming that ideas, models, new techniques etc. are your own.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: With modern technology this has become increasingly easy to do, but correspondingly increasingly easy to detect. Anyone who suspects that it is happening will act immediately.  This also applies to a situation where you have lent someone your work to help them, and they have substantially reproduced it without acknowledgement.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Plagiarising someone else’s work is very different from the collaborative teamwork that helps you to develop ideas and is a shared learning activity.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: If unfair practice is detected for any assessed work organised by the School, including tests or examinations, the matter will be referred to the Director of Teaching.  They and their team will determine the appropriate course of action.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: If you are unclear as to what does or does not constitute plagiarism, you should seek advice from

text: Bangor University uses categorical and percentage marking. As a guideline, the relationship between percentage and categorical marks is shown in the table opposite. At master's level, you must achieve a grade of C- (50%) or above in order to pass each module.

text: The overall mark for a SUFONAMA graduate from Bangor will be calculated as the average of the mean mark for taught modules and the mark for the dissertation.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The availability and use of AI has increased rapidly over the last year and will continue to do so. It is likely that your future careers will involve some element of AI. Therefore, we do not ban the use of AI to support your work at Bangor University, but we do expect students who choose to use AI to do so responsibly.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The rules around plagiarism, for example, can easily be breached using this technology. You may find thisethical checklist for using AIa helpful guide. We expect that your work will be grounded in critical analysis, something which AI is (as yet) unable to do. The use of AI will be inappropriate for some assessments but may be suitable or even encouraged in others. Assessment instructions will detail what is and isn’t appropriate. If you are unsure, speak with your module organiser for further details.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The Faculty of Forest Sciences and Forest Ecology welcomes new students of the English-language Master's programmes with an orientation phase (“O-phase”) in the week before lectures begin. During the "O-Phase" you will get to know the faculty and receive all the information you need for a successful start to your studies.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can see an overview of our O-Phase here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Additionally, the International Office also offers new students with welcome events to prepare you for your studies in Göttingen and to get to know other students. The O-Phase provides you with an overview of the platforms you need to organise your studies, familiarise you with the university and the city of Göttingen. The International Office will show you around the campus and your faculty and even introduce you to some leisure activities. Registration is required for some offers. This can be done online.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can find an overview of Welcome events for new international students here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Students who would like to be met at the train station when they arrive in Göttingen and accompanied by a fellow student to their flat in Göttingen can register for our Buddy Service.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can read about the Buddy (Pick-up) Service for international students here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: There are many guides and offers to help you with the start of your studies.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The academic year consists of a winter semester (01 October to 31 March) and a summer semester (01 April to 30 September). Within a semester, there is a lecture period followed by an examination period (mid-October to mid-February, mid-April to mid-July) and a lecture-free period dedicated to self-study and providing time for holidays. Many students work or do internships during the lecture-free period.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Thedates of lecture periods and important dates and deadlinesvary from year to year.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can see the dates and deadlines here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You will be studying at the Faculty of Forest Sciences and Forest Ecology which is located in the North Campus of the university. Many students come by bike or take the city bus, which is included in your semester ticket.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can access a map of the university here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can take German courses atthe university free of charge. The courses are offered for all language levels. Before registering, you must takea placement testto find out which course level is suitable for you.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can read about the language courses for international students here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Göttingen is a student city with rich leisure opportunities. The city has three theatres, a symphony orchestra, and several cinemas. Popular annual events include the Night of Culture, the Jazz Festival, the International Literature Autumn and the European Film Festival.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: As a student at the University of Göttingen you will automatically have a culture ticket (Kulturticket) with your student ID. Withthe Kulturticket, you can get free or reduced admission to events at many cultural institutions in Göttingen.

text: The master’s thesis is an essential part of scientific training. For this research work, you have in total 6 months to complete your

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You will be supervised by at least two professors or experienced scientists; one of them should be a member of the faculty of Forest Sciences and Forest Ecology. About 2 months before starting your thesis, you should start choosing your topic and supervisors.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can find possible thesis topics either on

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Your own suggestions for a topic can also be discussed with a supervisor.

Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: German study culture and university rules might be very different from what you have experienced so far in your home country, but may be similar to what you experienced during your first year of study in Copenhagen. In Germany, students are expected to organize studying and learning independently.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: This study culture gives a lot of freedom but requires some discipline, responsibility and initiative from the students. If any problem occurs, you can ask the professors, lecturers orthe academic adviser. They will assist you in solving the problem.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Academic integrity is a quality associated withhigh standardsof teaching and learning, not plagiarism, which is seen as a crime in the scientific community. Plagiarism is the uncredited use (both intentional and unintentional) of somebody else’s words or ideas.A charge of plagiarism can have severe consequences, including failure of the course or even expulsion from theuniversity.

The results of the evaluation are usually discussed between lecturers and students some weeks later. The course evaluation is one of the instruments to assure and improve the quality of teaching at theUniversityof Göttingen.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: In the first weeks of the courses, the professors will usually agree with you about examination dates at the end of the courses. There will only be one exam date for each examination for each course every semester. You can only sit the exam in the exam period. If you have to repeat an exam, you must wait until the exam period of the next semester.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You must register for and withdraw from examinations in FlexNow. On FlexNow you can also see your academic records and statistics, and generate transcripts (e.g. for job applications, scholarship sponsors).

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can register for all types of exams up to 7 days before the exam date, and you can de-register for exams up to 24 hours beforehand. We recommend that you register for all upcoming exams in good time during the semester. If you do not want to take individual exams later, you can withdraw by the deregistration deadline.

text: None of the SUFONAMA partner universities tolerate plagiarism. It is a serious offence as the plagiarist takes credit for work that rightly belongs to someone else. In that sense it can be considered stealing.

text: During the week before the start of the autumn semester, an Orientation Programme is organised for all new international students coming to SLU. The programme is partly online and partly on campus.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: We encourage you to take part in the Orientation Programme as you will be given important information and also get to meet key people to contact for different purposes as well as meet the other students.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: A semester at SLU lasts for 20 weeks.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The autumn semester begins on the Monday which falls between 28 August and 3 September.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The spring semester begins on the first Monday after the end of the autumn semester.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The autumn and spring semester are both divided into two periods of 15 credits each.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: A master thesis course runs over one full semester.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can find the Academic Calendar and other important dates here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: SLU’s Alnarp campus is situated in a large park by the sea, west of Lund, north of Malmö and east of Copenhagen. This prime location makes Alnarp a gateway to the rest of Europe.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Here, students can take part in the many academic, social and sporting activities relax in the countryside and enjoy the metropolitan nightlife.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Surrounded by a 40-hectare park with lush green lawns and winding pathways, Alnarp campus is remarkably picturesque. It boasts the largest arboretum in Sweden, with 2 600 varieties of trees and shrubs.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can see a short film of the campus here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The thesis at SLU consists of a 30 credits course, and the specific requirements can be found in the syllabus for that specific course.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You will receive information about which specific thesis course that applies to you when you are starting the application process to the year at SLU.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can find guidelines for degree projects (the master’s thesis) at SLU here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Studying in Sweden involves critical thinking, freedom and responsibility. Gender equality and equal opportunities are very important.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can read more about studying in Sweden and at SLU here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can read about cheating and plagiarism at SLU here.

text: As SUFONAMA is a double degree, you will get a diploma from

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The process of issuing the diploma varies from partner university to partner university. However, before each university can issue your diploma, you need to ensure that 120 ECTS credit is recorded at each university.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: By now you should already have applied for a credit transfer from UCPH to your second-year university. If you have done this, you will now have 120 ECTS recorded with your second-year university.If you haven’t done this, please see this section for instructions.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Now you must ensure that the 60 ECTS credits from your second-year university are transferred to UCPH, so you’ll also have 120 ECTS recorded with UCPH as well. For that you need a certified transcript of records from your second-year university.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: In this section you can see how to get your transcript of records from the SUFONAMA partner you attended on your second year of studies.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: To obtain a certified transcript of records, please request it from the student administration atGT.studentadmin@bangor.ac.uk.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: At University of Göttingen a transcript of records is called a certificate of achievement.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: When you have successfully completed all second-year courses and your Master's thesis in Göttingen, please inform us by email (sufonama@uni-goettingen.de).

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: We will then provide you with a signed and stamped certificate of achievement, which you can use to apply for a credit transfer at University of Copenhagen.The courses from the first year in Copenhagen are listed as “passed” in our certificate of achievement. The grades are not transferred and are not included in the calculation of the final grade. The courses from Göttingen are listed with a grade.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: At Unipd, the name of the transcript of records is “graduation certificate with transcript of records”, as this is the final certificate.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You must check your online booklet on Uniweb one or two days after your thesis discussion and verify if the Final examination grade has been registered. Once it has been registered, you can request your certificate.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: To get the correct certificate, you must request the ‘Digital certificate for abroad’. Due to national regulations, you must pay a small tax of 16 Euros, but you will be reimbursed when you contact the TESAF Department.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can find instructions forhow to request the certificate here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You must order a transcript of records from SLU to get a certified transcript of records.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You order your transcript of records from SLU by filling out this form.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Once you have a certified transcript from your second-year university, you must apply for a credit transfer of the remaining 60 ECTS to UCPH.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: All credits will be transferred as pass/fail to your UCPH transcript.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You apply for a credit transfer on UCPH Study Information.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You diploma from UCPH will be issued no later than 8 weeks after you’ve applied for a credits transfer of the 60 ECTS from your second-year university to UCPH.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You can read about the UCPH diploma on UCPH Study Information.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The award of the degree is made after successful completion of the dissertation (master’s thesis) and grade confirmation at the examination board in October.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The awards team issue the certificate/transcripts of your studies at Bangor and instructions are sent by the awards team.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: You must complete a ‘final award check’ before your results can be issued.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: The final award check can be found on the student portal myBangor oryou can find it here.

project: Sustainable Forest and Nature Management
text: Both transcripts of records from Copenhagen and Göttingen will beforwardedto theExaminationOfficeto request the issuing of your diploma.You must make sure that your personal details (name, date of birth, place of birth, postal address) are up to date ineCampus, as these will be used to issue your diploma. text: IMSOGLO is jointly organized bya consortium of 4 renown European universitiesthat was established in 2018:

project: International Master in Soils and Global Change
text: The Consortium Partners arehighly complementaryin both geographical focus and disciplinary expertise of their research.

project: International Master in Soils and Global Change
text: Aarhus University and Ghent University work onarctic soils; Ghent University, BOKU University and the University of Göttingen work ontropical soils; and all partner universities work ontemperate soils.

project: International Master in Soils and Global Change
text: The complementarity in geographical research focus provides a variety in classroom examples and allows a rich choice in study areas for thesis research. While problems are often global, evidence-based solutions are mostly site-specific and need to be adapted to local conditions.

project: International Master in Soils and Global Change
text: The research expertise related to the specialization Soil Biogeochemistry and Global Change is mainly concentrated at BOKU University and the University of Göttingen; and that to the specialization Physical Land Resources and Global Change at Ghent University and Aarhus University. The involved research groups at BOKU University and the University of Göttingen intensively researchsoil biogeochemistry in relation to ecosystem dynamics and greenhouse gas fluxes from soils(natural, forestry and agricultural ecosystems), with a strong focus onsoil and plant interactions. At Ghent University and Aarhus University, research groups are strong inoptimizing soil-water management, soil degradation and land evaluation for land functioning in an ecosystem services context.

text: IMSOGLO is a2-year Master of Scienceprogramme containing120 ECTS creditsand leading to thejoint diploma of International Master in Science in Soils and Global Change. IMSOGLO is organized by four European universities and involvesmobilitybetween these partner universities.

project: International Master in Soils and Global Change
International Master in Soils and Global Change
text: IMSOGLO students jointly follow the 1st semester at Ghent University to obtain and supplement theirfundamental soil science knowledge. The 1st semester is kicked off by the 1-week jointPrimer Eventduring which students are introduced to the programme, and get to know each other and staff members of all four partner universities.

project: International Master in Soils and Global Change
text: The remaining semesters are spent either at Ghent University (Belgium) and Aarhus University (Denmark) for the specializationSoil Ecosystem Services and Global Change, or at BOKU University (Austria) and the University of Göttingen (Germany) for the specializationSoil-Plant System Processes and Global Change. The 2nd and 3rd semester consist of mandatory and elective courses,deepeningthe students’ knowledge and skills in the chosen specialization, andbroadeningthe students’ knowledge and skills. Soft skill courses and internship are among the offered electives.

project: International Master in Soils and Global Change
text: Students from both specializations will meet again during theSummer Schoolbetween the 1st and 2nd year. The 4th semester will be devoted to themaster thesis. All IMSOGLO theses are supervised by supervisors of at least two partner universities.

project: International Master in Soils and Global Change
International Master in Soils and Global Change
text: From the 2nd semester onwards, IMSOGLO includestwo elective specializations.

project: International Master in Soils and Global Change
text: The specializationSoil-Plant System Processes and Global Changeis organized byGhent University(Belgium),BOKU University(Austria) and theUniversity of Göttingen(Germany) and leads to ajoint master diplomaissued by these three universities.

project: International Master in Soils and Global Change
text: This specialization focuses on the interactions between soils, plants, microbes and management in a changing world. There is a strong emphasis on biogeochemical processes in managed and natural ecosystems across different climates, to understand the feedbacks between land management, environmental impacts and global change.

project: International Master in Soils and Global Change
text: Keywords:soil-plant interactions; biogeochemistry; microbiology; agroforestry; agro-ecology

project: International Master in Soils and Global Change
International Master in Soils and Global Change
text: The specializationSoil Ecosystem Services and Global Changeis organized byGhent University(Belgium) andAarhus University(Denmark), and leads to ajoint master diplomaissued by these two universities.

project: International Master in Soils and Global Change
text: This specialization focuses on optimizing soil management, prevention and remediation of soil degradation, and land evaluation for land functioning in an ecosystem services context. Also, soil processes and how to describe them from a point scale to larger scale are covered.

project: International Master in Soils and Global Change
text: Keywords:soil degradation; soil protection; soil restoration; ecosystem functioning; soil-water cycle; C cycle; element fluxes; soil mapping

project: International Master in Soils and Global Change

project: International Master in Soils and Global Change
text: This specialization focuses on the interactions between soils, plants, microbes and management in a changing world. International Master in Soils and Global Change
International Master in Soils and Global Change
International Master in Soils and Global Change
International Master in Soils and Global Change
text: Increased population pressure, industrialisation and intensive land use causedepletion of natural resourcesandlimit the performance of landwith respect to its functions such as biomass production, carbon sequestration, and water purification. The additive effects ofclimate changeand the abovementioned aspects of global change influence the capacity of soils to sustain functions to provide planetary services and human wellbeing.Soil(pedosphere) forms the interface between the air (atmosphere) and the earth (lithosphere) and interacts with surface and groundwater (hydrosphere) and living organisms (biosphere). It is thus a vital component of ecosystems and needs to be secured.

project: International Master in Soils and Global Change
text: Specialised soil scientists are neededto understand and address the impact of climate change on soil conditions and processes, and vice versa.

project: International Master in Soils and Global Change
text: The International Master in Soils and Global Change (IMSOGLO)educates this next generation of soil scientists equipping them with the knowledge and skills to understand the chemistry, physics and biology of soils, including their formation and interactions with plants, to measure, monitor and model soil properties and processes in space and time, andto develop and implement climate-smart soil management policies.

project: International Master in Soils and Global Change
text: Graduates of IMSOGLO are able to contribute tomulti-, inter-, and transdisciplinary workin different ecosystems. This allows them to navigate the often competing interests of land users, managers, and other stakeholders, and to understand and appreciate thevarious viewpoints at play. Additionally, students have a deep understanding ofhigh-order targetssuch as the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and other international and European ambitions, such as the EU’s Green Deal. They are able to makeconscious contributions to policy-relevant research, crucial for sustainable soil use and conserving soil health in the face of climate change.

text: The Ecole Centrale de Lyon and especially its internal school in Saint-Etienne – ENISE (FR),in collaboration with the University of Ljubljana – ULJ (Slovenia), the Polytechnic University of Turin – PoliTO (Italy),the Norwegian University of Science and Technology – NTNU (Norway) as well as the Technical University of Chemnitz – TUC (Germany)and Mines Saint-Etienne – EMSE (FR), have thus drawn on their previous academic relationshipsto define the globally unique MSc inManufacturing 4.0 by intElligent and susTAinable technologies – meta 4.0.

text: École Centrale de Lyon, established in 1857, is one of the most prestigious graduate schools in France. Its research is especially strong in acoustics, nanotechnology, biosciences but also in manufacturing. Within the Ecole Centrale de Lyon, the École Nationale d’Ingénieurs de Saint-Étienne (ENISE), coordinator of this joint programme, is internationally recognized for its research in this field with the Laboratory for Tribology and System dynamics, part of the French National Centre for Scientific Research, and its research group based in Saint-Etienne.

project: Manufacturing 4.0 by intElligent and susTAinable technologies - META 4.0
Manufacturing 4.0 by intElligent and susTAinable technologies - META 4.0
text: Polytechnic University of Turin was thefirstItalian Engineering School,founded in 1859in the wave of the technical and scientific innovation that gave rise to the most prestigious European polytechnic schools in the mid-19th century.Engineers, architects, designers and urban planners have been trained at the Polytechnic University of Turinfor over 160 yearswith rigor, integrity and high-level standards. This long ever-changing history has rated Politecnico among thetop European technicalUniversities for education and research, with over37,000 studentsand a teaching staff of more than1,000.

project: Manufacturing 4.0 by intElligent and susTAinable technologies - META 4.0
Manufacturing 4.0 by intElligent and susTAinable technologies - META 4.0
text: University of Ljubljana is the oldest and largest higher education and scientific research institution in Slovenia, with its rich tradition founded in 1919. It has approximately 40,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students and employs around 6,000 higher education teachers, researchers, assistants and administrative staff in 23 faculties and three arts academies. The University of Ljubljana has been ranked among the top 500 universities by the prestigious Academic Ranking of World Universities. The central building, all three academies and faculties are located in the centre, giving the university and its students a ubiquitous presence in the city.

project: Manufacturing 4.0 by intElligent and susTAinable technologies - META 4.0
text: Norwegian University of Science and Technology in Norway

project: Manufacturing 4.0 by intElligent and susTAinable technologies - META 4.0
text: The Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU) is a public university in Norway and the largest university by enrolment in the country. NTNU in its current form was established by the King-in-Council in 1996 by the merger of the former University of Trondheim and other university-level institutions, with roots dating back to 1760. The university’s headquarters campus is located in Trondheim, with regional campuses in Ålesund and Gjøvik. NTNU is consistently ranked in the top one percentage among the world’s universities with about 9,000 employees and 42,000 students.

project: Manufacturing 4.0 by intElligent and susTAinable technologies - META 4.0
text: Technical University of Chemnitz in Germany

project: Manufacturing 4.0 by intElligent and susTAinable technologies - META 4.0
text: Chemnitz University of Technology is acosmopolitan universitywith strong regional, national and international networks. It is home to about2,300 academic and administrative employeesas well as more than9,600 studentsfrom about90 countries. It is thus the third largest university in Saxony. In terms of the proportion of foreign students, Chemnitz University of Technology occupies a top position among state universities nationwide. Chemnitz, theEuropean Capital of Culture 2025, owes many years of positive development to its university, as Chemnitz University of Technology is theintellectual heart of the cityand has developed into aninternationally visible research location for future value creation processes and sustainable future security.

project: Manufacturing 4.0 by intElligent and susTAinable technologies - META 4.0
Manufacturing 4.0 by intElligent and susTAinable technologies - META 4.0
text: École Nationale Supérieure des Mines de Saint-Étienne is a graduate engineering school and research institute aka « Grande École d’Ingénieurs » founded in 1816. It is a part of the prestigious Institut Mines-Télécom and is focused on training engineers in the fields of materials science, industrial engineering but also energy, environment, and sustainable development. With declared core values of “Education, Research and Dedication to Economic Development” it aims to be “a laboratory and a key player in the industry of the future”.

text: MorphoPHENis a one-year Erasmus Mundus Joint Master (60 ECTS), divided in two semesters of 30 ECTS each. It brings knowledge on the four main branches necessary to analyze mouse disease models morphologically:Anatomy and Embryology, Pathology, Imaging, and Deep Learning.This curriculum is divided in the following Teaching Modules:

text: The mobility starts with the Joint Inception Week at UAB in Spain where students will be enrolled in the MorphoPHEN master program. Matter related with visas, stay permits, fiscal code request, insurance, access to health systems, and housing will be discussed with students during the Joint Inception Week. At the beginning of first semester, students remain at UAB and follow the Module 1 (mouse anatomy, embryology, and pathobiology), then students move to UNINA in Italy to learn the anatomical basis of imaging, imaging modalities, and diagnose by image (Module 2). During the second semester students will move to move to AUTH in Greece to continue with Module 3 (deep learning applied to mouse imaging diagnostics and experimental design). Finally, in the second semester students can undertake their master’s degree dissertation under supervision of any partner university.

project: Human Diseases Models Morphological Phenotyping
text: MorphoPHENis supported by the high-level multidisciplinary network of associated partners. They give lectures, participate in the scientific boards of the master’s program and offer master’s degree dissertation projects for the MorphoPHEN students.

project: Human Diseases Models Morphological Phenotyping
Human Diseases Models Morphological Phenotyping
text: Two universities,the University of Cambridge (UCAM) pioneer in developing mouse ontologies and informatics, and the universities of Copenhagen (UCPH) specialized in mouse pathology.

project: Human Diseases Models Morphological Phenotyping
text: Four major European mouse clinics(CERBM-ICS, MRC Harwell, HMGU, and CCP-IMG) equipped with integrated facilities for production and characterization of genetically engineered mouse models are also associated partners of MorphoPHEN. These mouse clinics are developing and using state of art mouse imaging technologies and have long-standing expertise in pathology phenotyping along with the data-capture, annotation, and bioinformatic analysis capabilities to interpret the resulting datasets.

project: Human Diseases Models Morphological Phenotyping
text: Two of the largest producers and suppliers of mouse modelsworldwide heavily involved in drug research (CHARLES RIVER, and TCP), anda company leader in the field of preclinical imaging(FF-SS) are also essential associated partners of MorphoPHEN.

project: Human Diseases Models Morphological Phenotyping
text: Finally, the interaction withtwo international mouse phenotyping consortiumsINFRAFRONTIER, IMPC, andthe South American Institut Pasteur de Montevideo, and the Veterinary Pathology Core Laboratory of St. Jude Children’s Research Hospitalprovides MorphoPHEN with a unique and preeminent global position to teach a common and fundamental skill set and required knowledge to validate morphologically mouse models of human diseases.

text: Last awarded degree: Bachelor of Science in Biochemical Engineering, University of Debrecen, Hungary.(Graduation Year: 2023)Research Interests: Aging, Neuropsychopharmacology, Applied ML in Biomedical Imaging.

project: Human Diseases Models Morphological Phenotyping
Human Diseases Models Morphological Phenotyping
text: During my Master’s thesis at MorphoPHEN, I focused on characterizing astroglial and microglial populations in the central nervous system of a mouse model with Megalencephalic Leukodystrophy with Subcortical Cysts (MLC), an ultra-rare disorder. This research was conducted at Dr. Assumpció Bosch’s lab at the Institute of Neuroscience (INc), where the primary focus is on gene therapy for central nervous system diseases, as part of the TherCNS project at the Universitat Autònoma de Barcelona.Through the rigorous mobility program, particularly at the University of Naples Federico II, I developed a keen interest in cancer drug delivery and multimodal bioimaging, specifically μCT-FMT, after participating in practical sessions at CEINGE Biotecnologie Avanzate Franco Salvatore Scarl. Currently, I am a Lyon Excellence Candidate at the Cancer Research Center of Lyon (CRCL), University of Lyon, France. I am eager to integrate the knowledge gained from MorphoPHEN to explore innovative approaches in the development of pre-clinical cancer therapeutics

text: Human Diseases Models Morphological Phenotyping(MorphoPHEN) consists of an integrated and interdisciplinary Erasmus Mundus Joint Master. It is conceived to alleviate the real shortage of experts in morphological mouse phenotyping, which is needed to generate a positive impact of preclinical biomedicine and improve human translatability (from the bench to the bedside).
