European Master in Law and Economics
text: In March you will receive an email about the status of your application. If you have been accepted and you confirm that you will join EMLE, we will after a few weeks follow up regarding where we have allocated you. With paying the first installment, you accept your spot and these allocations. Later on, it is possible to request a reallocation for the first two terms. In December you will also be able to request reallocation for the third term. Please findheremore information about how students are allocated and re-allocated to the different EMLE universities.

project: European Master in Law and Economics
text: Once a student has been accepted, there are many questions that come up, including how to best prepare oneself for the programme, what specific immigration rules exist for the various countries, what the range of living costs are in the different cities, and what the rules and regulations are regarding the thesis. These questions should be answered within the pages of this section, preparing future EMLE students for their exciting and challenging year.

project: European Master in Law and Economics
text: In addition, our previous students are more than willing to share their experiences in the EMLE programme with prospective students. For a detailed account of what it’s like to be an EMLE student, please read thereport by Nadia Cookand feel free to reach out to her in case of any questions. Each term student representatives are chosen in each allocation to represent their cohort and assist the EMLE management team in student matters. Our current students representatives are also able to give a lot of insights into the EMLE programme and are open to answering any questions by prospective students (please send an e-mail toinfo@emle.org).

project: European Master in Law and Economics
European Master in Law and Economics
text: Programme PreparationContactRegularly check your email once you have been admitted to EMLE, also during the summer. You will receive several emails containing information and asking you to do certain things. You will be given an @emle.eu email address. From then on, all communication will go through this email address, so make sure to check this.No matter what your first term university is, all EMLE students will be registered at Erasmus University Rotterdam as well. You will also receive an email address from EUR. Make sure the check this mailbox as well, since registration at EUR will go through this. The login (ERNA) credentials you receive from EUR are also important to make use of their online facilities.HousingNot all universities offer accommodation to incoming students. In most cities, you will have to find housing yourself. You will be contacted about this over the summer. If your university does not provide housing, start looking for accommodation in time. In some cities it can be very difficult to find housing last minute.Typically the following universities offer dorms, but we cannot guarantee that they do so every year:Aix-en-Provence: contact around JanuaryHaifa: limited number available so order as soon as possibleHamburg: only first and second termMumbaiWarsawRome (for more information clickhereandhere)VisaIf necessary, you will be timely contacted about how to obtain a visa. Please follow all instructions you receive closely and promptly, as to avoid that you do not have a visa when the first term starts. Some visa procedures are more difficult or take much longer than you would expect.Visa processIntra EU Mobility Visa:informationImmigration rules:–Aix-en-Provence–Barcelona–Ghent–Haifa–Hamburg–Mumbai–Rome–Rotterdam–WarsawLiving CostsThe cost of living can vary quite a bit between partner universities. To get an impression of the cost of living at your allocations, please clickhere.Information about allocationIn March you will receive an email about the status of your application. If you have been accepted and you confirm that you will join EMLE, we will after a few weeks follow up regarding where we have allocated you. With paying the first installment, you accept your spot and these allocations. Later on, it is possible to request a reallocation for the first two terms. In December you will also be able to request reallocation for the third term.

text: Regularly check your email once you have been admitted to EMLE, also during the summer. You will receive several emails containing information and asking you to do certain things. You will be given an @emle.eu email address. From then on, all communication will go through this email address, so make sure to check this.

project: European Master in Law and Economics
text: No matter what your first term university is, all EMLE students will be registered at Erasmus University Rotterdam as well. You will also receive an email address from EUR. Make sure the check this mailbox as well, since registration at EUR will go through this. The login (ERNA) credentials you receive from EUR are also important to make use of their online facilities.

project: European Master in Law and Economics

text: Not all universities offer accommodation to incoming students. In most cities, you will have to find housing yourself. You will be contacted about this over the summer. If your university does not provide housing, start looking for accommodation in time. In some cities it can be very difficult to find housing last minute.

project: European Master in Law and Economics
European Master in Law and Economics
text: Students should begin to think about potential thesis topics as early as possible.Thesis proposals are due in January after which the first thesis meetings take place at the beginning of February. Students can discuss their ideas for the thesis with the third term coordinators and faculty. Sometimes associate partners (clickherefor more information) can provide thesis topics for students as well. Once the thesis title is officially agreed upon, students may begin working on the thesis.

project: European Master in Law and Economics
text: All students will be assigned a supervisor and an external examiner to grade the thesis. The supervisor will be a member of staff at the third term university who is available to guide the students in writing their thesis. Moreover, most third term universities offer thesis seminars in which the students are required to present their ideas for the thesis and to discuss them with their fellow students. The names and contact details of the supervisors will be published in due course.

project: European Master in Law and Economics
text: It is important to point out the weight of the thesis. Each marker can award a maximum of 30 points, meaning that the thesis counts as much as six term exams.

project: European Master in Law and Economics
text: Before you start working on the thesis, please read thoroughly the Thesis Guide and EMLE Exam and Thesis Regulations, which you can find under theOfficial Documents. It has unfortunately become necessary to issue a severe warning against the offence of plagiarism in the thesis (see EMLE Board Decision on Plagiarism).

project: European Master in Law and Economics

project: European Master in Law and Economics
European Master in Law and Economics
text: Each year in mid-February all students of the current academic year and scholars from the partner universities come together in Ghent, Rotterdam or Hamburg to discuss topics of Law & Economics and the future of the EMLE programme. The Midterm Meeting attracts one of the largest groups of Law & Economics scholars in Europe and is guaranteed to be a great experience, both academically and socially.

project: European Master in Law and Economics
text: The Midterm Meeting takes place on a Thursday and Friday. On Thursday, students arrive at the hosting partner university where they have the possibility to attend a student event (e.g., career development workshop, networking event). The Midterm Meeting continues on Friday which revolves around a one-day symposium.

project: European Master in Law and Economics
text: In the morning, scholars in the field of Law & Economics (including many of our own staff) present and discuss their recent papers during the academic workshops.  In addition, the symposium culminates in an invited lecture by a distinguished scholar of Law & Economics. For example, the lecture was given by Guido Calabresi from Yale Law School in 2021 (clickhereto see the recording) and by Katharina Pistor from Columbia Law School in 2022 (clickhereto see the recording). In the afternoon, it has become a tradition to invite the student who in the previous academic year wrote the best thesis to present his or her work at the symposium. The day ends with the Associate Partner Meeting during which our students can get in contact with representatives of the institutions that the EMLE cooperates with (clickherefor more information on our associate partners). In the evening all participants enjoy theconference dinner, which is among the highlights of the meeting.

European Master in Law and Economics
text: The EMLE programme started in 1990-1991. Since then, it grew substantially and has evolved over time. We are interested to keep a strong bond to our Alumni and hear from them about their experience and ideas for improvement of their EMLE programme, it is most important for us to be able to give them the possibility to network and benefit from each other’s knowledge on different jurisdictions. Our alumni are from all over the world, so: wherever you go, you will find some fellow EMLEs!

project: European Master in Law and Economics
text: On this page, you can find out in which sectors our Alumni work, you can read the experience of some Alumni and you can find out how to stay in touch.

project: European Master in Law and Economics
European Master in Law and Economics
text: If you would like to reach out to your former EMLE colleagues or get into touch with EMLE students from different years, you can stay in touch viaFacebookorLinkedIn. On each channel, the EMLE maintains an alumni group where graduates can keep in contact with each other and discuss issues related to Law and Economics. The group is also used by the programme management to post items of possible interest for EMLE Alumni.

project: European Master in Law and Economics
text: We also warmly invite all Alumni to come to the yearly Midterm Meeting which takes place in February.

project: European Master in Law and Economics
text: Clickhereto read more about a recent alumni reunion at Erasmus University Rotterdam.

project: European Master in Law and Economics
text: For any questions, suggestions or ideas, you can send an email toalumni@emle.org.

project: European Master in Law and Economics
text: We are currently busy building up a strong alumni network. One of the dreams of the alumni network is to connect more experienced EMLE Alumni with current students or recent alumni for career guidance and general information, but also trying to set up internship options for interested students in companies that are in the EMLE network. If your firm would be willing to provide internships or other career opportunities for EMLE students, we would be very happy to get in touch with you about it. Please send an email toalumni@emle.orgif you are interested or if you have any questions.

project: European Master in Law and Economics
text: All EMLE Alumni are qualified to join the Erasmus Mundus Students and Alumni Association.The EMA offers an international professional and personal network for Erasmus Mundus students and graduates – please clickhere.

project: European Master in Law and Economics
text: EMA has an EMLE Programme Representative. Her name is Zara Kaushik, and she introduces herself as follows:

project: European Master in Law and Economics
text: I graduated from the EMLE programme in the academic year 2012/13, across Universität Hamburg, Università di Bologna, and Erasmus Universiteit Rotterdam. In the short run the EMLE experience was challenging and enlivening – the mix of courses across universities as well as the international experience was transformative. In the longer run I have found that the understanding of different jurisdictions, as well as the theoretical underpinnings of laws and how they must be informed by a discipline such as economics, has stayed with me and influenced my own practice of law in India.

project: European Master in Law and Economics
text: For the year 2023/24, I am Programme Representative for the EMLE at the Erasmus Mundus Students and Alumni Association (EMA). EMA is a nonprofit that gathers participants of all Erasmus Mundus master and doctoral programmes under an umbrella, enabling networking, upskilling and support throughout the community. As EMLE Programme Representative I will act as a connector between the EMLE programme and EMA, as well as a point of contact for the EMLE student and alumni community should they wish to take advantage of the larger EMA network. For any questions or to be redirected to appropriate support, please feel free to write to me atemle@em-a.eu.

project: European Master in Law and Economics
text: This privacy policy applies to all activities of EMLE and provides the most relevant information by target group. EMLE handles personal data with care and acts within the limits of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). EMLE processes personal data and uses cookies for its website. In this privacy policy, we provide information about the purposes for which personal data are processed, how you can exercise your privacy rights and other information that could be important to you.

project: European Master in Law and Economics
European Master in Law and Economics
text: We value your privacy. Information relating to individuals is collected and used in accordance with the GDPR. As a rule, all data submitted to EMLE is only used for the purposes of the EMLE program, namely the admission to and teaching and improvement of EMLE courses. Data collected in this way is only made available to the partner universities and their technical staff. In addition, the personal data of students admitted to the programme (i.e. proposed for a scholarship, put on the reserve list, or enrolled on a self-paying basis) may be used for the purposes of evaluating the Erasmus Mundus Programme and will be made available to the Agency, the EM National Structures, the EU Delegations and the Erasmus Mundus Student and Alumni Association, acting as stakeholders of the programme. Please note that this website also provides links to third party sites. We encourage you to review their respective privacy policies since the EMLE has no influence on those third parties.

project: European Master in Law and Economics
text: The European Education and Culture Executive Agency (EACEA), in the context of managing the Erasmus Mundus Joint Masters, collects and processes the personal data of some of the candidates. In particular, certain data of the scholarship holders and non-scholarship holders is shared with the Agency and treated according to thisprivacy statement.

project: European Master in Law and Economics
European Master in Law and Economics
text: On EMLE’s instructions, third parties may provide certain parts of the services for the implementation of an agreement. We reach agreements with these organizations to ensure that personal data are treated with care and in confidence. These agreements are contractually recorded in data processing and other agreements. If parties are based outside the European Economic Area (EEA), additional and appropriate safeguards will be put in place. Your personal data are not hired or sold to third parties. EMLE provides personal data to enforcement authorities or fraud control organizations if this is necessary to comply with statutory obligation.

project: European Master in Law and Economics
European Master in Law and Economics
text: EMLE does not keep your data longer than is strictly necessary to realize the purposes for which the data were gathered. Among other things, EMLE observes the retention periods provided for in the Dutch Public Records Act (elaborated in the Basic Selection Document for University Education (BSD) of University Education 1985 and in the Selection List for Universities and University Medical Centres 2020), as well as other legislation, for instance tax and labour legislation. If you choose to exercise any of your rights, this may affect the retention period observed for your personal data.

project: European Master in Law and Economics
text: Your rights and exercising these rights (digital portal)

project: European Master in Law and Economics
text: As a data subject, you have various rights under the GDPR. Clickhereto exercise your rights.

project: European Master in Law and Economics
European Master in Law and Economics
text: “This website uses Google Analytics, a web analytics service provided by Google, Inc. (“Google”). Google Analytics uses “cookies”, which are text files placed on your computer, to help the website analyze how users use the site. The information generated by the cookie about your use of the website (including your IP address) will be transmitted to and stored by Google on servers in the United States . Google will use this information for the purpose of evaluating your use of the website, compiling reports on website activity for website operators and providing other services relating to website activity and internet usage. Google may also transfer this information to third parties where required to do so by law, or where such third parties process the information on Google’s behalf. Google will not associate your IP address with any other data held by Google. You may refuse the use of cookies by selecting the appropriate settings on your browser, however please note that if you do this you may not be able to use the full functionality of this website. By using this website, you consent to the processing of data about you by Google in the manner and for the purposes set out above.”

project: European Master in Law and Economics
European Master in Law and Economics
text: The EMLE strives to keep this website as up to date as possible and to make sure all information is true and accurate. Despite this, the EMLE cannot guarantee that all information is always accurate and complete. In case of doubt, please do not hesitate to contact us atinfo@emle.org. The EMLE is not responsible or liable for any damage or loss arising from the use of this website. The EMLE is also not responsible for the content of websites of third parties, linked to from this website.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: eGovernance and the digitalisation of the public sector are most likely among the most important reform trends for the future of the public sector.That is why the future public sector needs experts who combine knowledge in public administration and public management on the one hand, and information systems and eGovernance on the other.The Erasmus Mundus Master of Science in Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance is a unique programme delivering those experts.

text: The PIONEER programme can award 15 scholarships to promisingnon-EEA candidatesper intake or new academic year. To be eligible, these students should submit their application by March 1.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Unfortunately,we do not award scholarships to EEA candidates.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Mind that if you havepreviously been awarded an Erasmus Mundus scholarship, you can apply to the programme but arenot eligible anymorefor a scholarship.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Scholarship - I have more than one nationality, which one do I use?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: All students are requested to indicate their nationality during their application. In case they have adouble nationality, students shouldchoose only one. However, be aware that your choice may have implications for your chances of being selected for a scholarship: Erasmus Mundus rules stipulate that no more than 10% of our scholarships can go to applicants from the same nationality. We currently receive many excellent applications from Pakistan and India.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Scholarship - How do I apply for the scholarship?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: All non-EEA candidates who submit their applicationbeforetheMarch 1deadline willautomaticallybeconsideredfor an Erasmus Mundus scholarship (i.e., no application form or request must be filled out separately).

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: To submit your application, follow the instructions on theKU Leuven website.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Scholarship - How does the selection process work?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Hence, you will be updated on whether you are accepted to the programme separately from whether you are shortlisted for a scholarship. The final admissions will only occur after the scholarship interviews.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Scholarship - What are my chances of getting a scholarship?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: We have receivedaround 300 applications for approximately 15 scholarshipsin recent years.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Erasmus Mundus rules stipulate thatno more than 10%of our scholarships can goto applicants from the same nationality. We currently receive many excellent applications from Pakistan and India, which affects the competition for applicants from these countries.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Scholarship - What does the scholarship cover?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: The scholarship is worth1,400 EUR monthlyand will bepaid from September (first year of study) to August (second year of study). It will contribute to the costs incurred by the beneficiary students and covers tuition fee, travel, visa, installation and subsistence expenses.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Under no circumstanceswill payments be madebeforethe student arrives in Leuven andthe academic year officially starts, even though candidates and admitted students will incur multiple expenses during the preparation of their studies. Please bear this in mind.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Scholarship - I was not selected for a scholarship, can I still come?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Our Selection Committee makes two different decisions. One is about your admission to the programme. The second is about you being shortlisted for a scholarship.If you are not selected for a scholarship you may still be admitted as a self-supporting student.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: If you accept the offer to participate on a self-funding basis, you willautomaticallybecomeeligible for an Erasmus+ grant for the second semester in Münster. You do not have to submit a scholarship application yourself. Admissions Office will do this for you once you are registered. You can find more information about this scholarship atErasmus+ grants (programme countries and UK) – Student (kuleuven.be).

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Admission - How & Deadlines - When do admissions open, how do I apply and by when do I have to submit?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Admissions for the upcoming academic year traditionallyopen on the Third Thursday of the academic year at KU Leuven(mid-October)

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: To submit your application—whether or not you are eligible for a scholarship and which to apply for it—, follow the instructions on theKU Leuven website.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Deadlinesfor submitting your application file (non-scholarship procedure) aredependent onyournationality:

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Given that the available spots are limited (i.e., we strive for intakes or student cohorts between 30 and 40 students) and we receive many applications,we urge you to apply as early as possible.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Admission - Eligibility - I have not graduated yet, can I apply?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Yes, you can. In case you are selected, you will be admitted on the condition of obtaining your Bachelor of Arts (BA.) or Bachelor of Science (BSc.) by the start of the academic year.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Admission - Eligibility - I have already worked for some time after my Bachelors. Am I eligible?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Yes, many applicants have some work experience, or already completed another Master’s programme.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Admission - Eligibility - I applied last year, can I apply again?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Admission - APS - I am a Chinese/Indian/Vietnamese applicant, do I require an APS certificate to apply?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Although we require all Chinese, Indian, and Vietnamese candidates to submit an APS certificate as soon as possible, we know that the procedure is costly and that waiting can be very long.You can, however,provisionally applyto the programme without an APS certificate. Based on the PIONEER Admission Office’s decision (i.e., ‘Reject’ or ‘Conditional Accept’), you can decide whether pursuing this procedure is useful.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Of course, in case of a ‘Conditional Accept’, you can only officially register as a PIONEER student once we receive the APS certificate. We recommend starting the procedure at least three months before, preferably even sooner.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Admission - application fee - Do I have to pay the application fee?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: No, allPIONEER applicants are exemptedfrom paying the application fee. Pleaseupload thisdocumentinto the application file for the fee to be waived.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Admission - tuition fee - Can I be exempted from paying the tuition fee or receive a reduction?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: No,thetuition fee applies at all timesand is the same for EEA and non-EEA students: €4,591.10for the2025-2026PIONEERintake. Tuition fees are paid each academic year for which students are registered and normally increase each year unless specified. This fee is covered either by an Erasmus Mundus scholarship or by yourself as you register on a self-supporting basis.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: For their semester in Münster(2nd semester),all self-supporting students are eligible to receive anErasmus+ grantfor student exchange (compensating five months of study, starting from April). The amount they receive monthly depends on the destination country and will be around 419 euros for Germany during academic year 2024-2025.Youdo not have to submit a scholarship application yourself, Admissions Office will do this for you once you are officially registered. You can find more information about the Erasmus+ grantsat our website.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Admission - Criteria - What are the selection criteria?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Our Selection Committee, comprising of representatives from all three PIONEER Consortium partners, assesses application files based on the followingcriteria:

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Admission - Recommendation - Does the programme require recommendation letters from my (former) professors or employer(s)?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: No, thesubmission of recommendation letters is not required, given that the Selection Committee will not read or consider these letters.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Admission - Appeal - What if I do not agree with the Selection Committee's decision?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: You can appeal the decision bysubmitting a motivated appealto the KU LeuvenProgramme Directorat the level of the Department of Political Sciences.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Academic requirements - How can I enhance my chances of being selected if my academic background is irrelevant to the programme?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: PIONEER accepts students with sound knowledge, experience and/or a sincere interest in the public sector and digitalisation. To this end, ourSelection Committee assessesapplicationfiles according tothe following criteria:

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Academic requirements - Can I ask a professor or staff member for a prior assessment of my profile?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: No,weprefer toevaluate yourprofile and applicationfile as we receive itthrough the officialKU Leuven application procedure. Please read our ‘About’ section and the answer to the above question carefully. These already offer a lot of information to help you develop a good self-assessment. In addition, you can look at our current student profiles to see how they resonate with your profile.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Language requirements - I come from an English-speaking country. Can I be exempted?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: All applicants who have not obtained a previous diploma in a programme taught in English inAustralia, English-speaking Canada, Ireland, New Zealand, the United Kingdomand theUnited States of Americamust submit a certificate proving their proficiency in English.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: This implies that if you obtained your diploma in a country other than those mentioned above, you must submit one of the accepted tests, even if your studies were in English. The university allowsno exceptionsand sets this requirement to guarantee the English proficiency of our admitted students.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Language requirements - I completed my prior studies in English. Can I be exempted?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: All applicants who have not obtained a previous diploma in a programme taught in English inAustralia, English-speaking Canada, Ireland, New Zealand, the United Kingdomand theUnited States of Americamust submit a certificate proving their proficiency in English.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: This implies that if you obtained your diploma in a country other than those mentioned above, you must submit one of the accepted tests, even if your studies were in English. The university allowsno exceptionsand sets this requirement to guarantee the English proficiency of our admitted students.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Language requirements - Which language certificates will be accepted?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: English proficiency test scores accepted by KU Leuven are theTOEFL iBTcertificate,IELTS Academiccertificate (including paper, computer and online versions; excluding IELTS One Skill Retake scores),Cambridge C1 Advanced(CAE) orC2 Proficiency(CPE) certificate, and theITACEfor Students C1 or C2 certificate. For more information on these tests, consult ourlanguage requirementspage.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Language requirements - How old might my language certificates be?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: For an IELTS certificate to be accepted by KU Leuven, we need to be able to verify the test result online using the official IELTS verification website. Unfortunately, IELTS test results remain available for online verification forthree years only.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Language requirements - What if I fail to obtain a certificate before the application deadline?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Although we encourage all candidates to get their language certificate as soon as possible, we know that waiting times to take a language test can be very long in some countries.You can, however,provisionally applyto the programme without a language certificateprovided that you submit a test booking confirmationinstead.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Internship - Can I combine my studies with an internship?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Students canpursue a paid or unpaid internshipduring their free timeor in the fourth semester. The organisation of this type of internship lies entirely outside PIONEER and therefore with the students themselves. Please check the section on ‘voluntary internships’ on theKU Leuven website.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: There are no specific additional rules for PIONEER scholarship holders.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Living in Leuven/Münster/Tallinn - Will I get a room in a student dorm?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: The PIONEER Consortium advertises student residencesto (prospective) students,but slots are not guaranteed. Therefore, we advise admitted students to not only rely on these options but to also prospect themselves on the university and private markets.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: InLeuven, we may have limited rooms available for PIONEERs for the first semester at student residence‘De Vesten’. However, this depends on availabilities and trends in the Leuven student room market. We traditionally inform admitted students about the possibilities at De Vesten around May. For offers on the private market in Leuven, please check ourhousing information.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: InMünster, theStudierendenwerkoffers several spots for the second semester. Students must apply online from the beginning of the academic year (!). The Housing Office then contacts them. You will receive information once you have arrived in Leuven.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Finally,Tallinn‘s housing market is very dynamic; students usually find rooms for the third semester.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Living in Leuven/Münster/Tallinn - How expensive is life in Europe?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Ourwebsiteoffers you a handy overview ofprominent expensesand their expected amounts in Belgium. For the sake of comparison: Belgium ranked between 10th and 14th position over the last five years when it comes cost of living within European countries.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Communication - Should I send a follow-up email if I have no answer from the programme?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Please be patientas we receive many application files to process. All the information is centralised by the PIONEER mailbox (fsw.pioneer@kuleuven.be), and you will get a reply soon.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Response time can be even longer around application deadlines.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Communication - What to do when I have a question not dealt with on this website?

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Did you carefully check all available information?In the unlikely event that we have overlooked vital information, please check theFAQsby KU Leuven.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Still no answer? Feel free to submit your question tofsw.pioneer@kuleuven.be.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Over the course oftwo academic years, PIONEER offers its international student group arich and interdisciplinary learningexperience founded on its excellent research agenda and accomplishments. In offering high-quality education, we purposefully connect academic knowledge to the practical challenges of professionals in policy, administrative, and consultative functions. Through case studies, you acquire insight into how the use of (technological) innovations can solve new problems in public administration and public policy. Hence, our focus is on the future of the public sector from the combined perspectives of Public Administration, Public Management, Information Systems, and eGovernance.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: PIONEER follows asemestral structureto convey expertise from these different research fields, focusing on a specific subdiscipline each time. That way, the programme allows you to studyinat least three different countries:

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Across semesters,PIONEERenvisions a clear set of learning objectives as itoffers you …

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Students start PIONEER in Leuven, where they receive an introduction to public administration and management.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: In the courseComparative Public Administration in Europe, for example, students gain in-depth knowledge of the European system(s) of public administration and governance through, amongst others, a co-creation game where they simulate the co-creation of a public service in two different countries.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: The coursePublic Innovationintroduces students to topics such as experimentalist governance and innovation procurement and includes field visits to (semi-) public organisations that play a role in public innovation, particularly digitalisation. Moreover, students receive a general primer on the use and design of information systems via a course on Business Information Systems.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: During the Leuven semester, students are also introduced to e-Governance practices via a course onDigital Public Governance, focusing on topics such as interoperability, blockchain technology and smart cities. The course includes an online module that supports students in developing a strategic innovation plan. During theIntegrated Research Seminarsessions, students gain insight into the different steps of the research process and acquire tips and tricks to conduct sound and meaningful scientific research.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Information systems and technologies in governance (30 ECTS)

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: The second semester focuses on enabling the students to assess and properly configure sophisticated information technology for use in public administration.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Students will receive in-depth scientific knowledge and skills in information systems within public administration and management. The courseEnterprise Architecture Management, for instance, covers the alignment of business/administration and IT, whileProject Managementgives insights into planning and handling (IT-) projects.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Another emphasis this semester is put on process and data management. The students gain knowledge in these fields of study in the context of public administration as part of the courseE-Government. While most courses use lectures and exercises to enable effective and efficient learning, the E-Government course also includes a simulation game in which students take on different roles with specific goals and interests in an e-Government scenario to experience firsthand what it means to modernise and digitalise the public sector. Finally, the second part of theintegrated research seminarexpands on the social science research skills acquired at KU Leuven and supplements these from an IS research perspective.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: In the third semester, students learn in-depth about the multifaceted relationships between governance, technological change and society.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: The Tallinn semester covers the public sector innovation and e-Governance fields by integrating disciplines into one coherent interdisciplinary knowledge framework. For instance, the idea of the courseGoverning in the Digital Ageis to discuss how digital technologies specifically and the digital era in general, shape governing in and by the public sector.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Public Sector Innovation Lab, on the other hand, has a hands-on approach as it partners up with Estonian public authorities and focuses on solving real-life public sector challenges. Similarly, other courses in Tallinn tackle technology, innovation and governance through interdisciplinary lenses that, aside from management issues, relate to many other aspects, including critique of technology, societal implications, wicked problems and entrepreneurship.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: The semester includes several dedicated meetings and site visits to gain comprehensive insights into the Estonian e-government.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: The Master’s Thesis is thecapstone projectof the PIONEERprogramme.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Thestudent can propose a topic and choose a preferred supervisor. The supervisor must be a PhD-holding staff member of one of the partner universities: KU Leuven, the University of Münster or Tallinn University of Technology. Upon receiving the student’s proposal and preferences, the eventual Master thesis topic and supervisor are decided by the Academic Steering Committee.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: The subject of the Master’s Thesis should be related to the domains of public administration and public management, information systems and e-Governance. The master’s thesis defence is organised in a rotating manner. Students are recommended to stay in the country or city where the supervisor’s university is located unless they perform a voluntary internship.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: The student isallowed to do a voluntary internshipin an organisation relevant to the Master’s Thesis topic. The internship can be more practice-oriented, such as in public sector organisations, international organisations or consultancy firms. The internship can also be more research-oriented, for instance, in a research institute, think tank or university department.

Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: TheErasmus Mundus Master of Science in Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance (PIONEER)is atwo-yearor 120 ECTSjoint master programmeorganised by KU Leuven (Belgium), the University of Münster (Germany) and Tallinn University of Technology (Estonia).

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: The general idea behind this master’s programme is that the public sector needs interdisciplinary expertise in order to be able to benefit fully from the potential of ICT and technological innovations. Within a context wherein digital becomes increasingly important for the modernisation and innovation of the public sector, the sector itself needs experts who (a) are able to translate technological expertise into efficiency, effectiveness, performance and user needs and (b) can take into account the organisational, cultural, social and structural peculiarities of the public sector when implementing new technologies. As a result,interdisciplinary educationhas become an absolute necessity. PIONEER offers this state of the art education.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: PIONEER provides students with specialised competencies in public sector innovation and the role of ICT and technological evolution. It is an interdisciplinary and international programme that combines academic expertise with insight into professional or practical cases and national experience. The programme isbuilt on four major principles:

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: The2025-2026 PIONEERintaketuition feeamounts toEUR 4,591.10. Tuition fees are paid each academic year for which students are registered and normally increase each year unless specified.

Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Follow this tread to find out more about the PIONEER Consortium Partners: the Belgian KU Leuven (KUL), the German University of Münster (WWU) and the Estonian Tallinn University of Technology (TalTech).

Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: The Erasmus Mundus (EM) Master of Science in Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance (PIONEER)deadlines depend onwhether you are(a)anEEA or Non-EEA applicantand(b) whetheror notyou wish to compete for an EM scholarship.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Keep in mind thatonly non-EEA applicants can apply for an EM scholarship.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Non-EEA candidateswho wish to compete for the limited number of scholarships should applybefore March 1. Applications we receive after this deadline will be considered regular (self-supporting) applications until June 1. When submitting after the March 1 deadline, applicants are responsible for evaluating whether they can apply for a visa, travel to Belgium and register on time. Be aware that each year, there are accepted applicants who do not manage to make such visa arrangements in time.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: EEA candidatesare urged to submit their applicationbefore June 1. These applications will be considered on a rolling basis until August 31.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Admissionsfor the upcoming academic year traditionallyopen on the third Thursday of the academic year at KU Leuven(mid-October). Candidates can submit their application and concomitant files via theKU Leuven application tool. Read the next section on application requirements carefully before starting your application!

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: To apply to the PIONEER programme, candidates must meet three types of requirements: academic, language and document requirements.Failing to comply with one of these results in a straight rejection of your application file.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Successful applicants are holders ofat least a Bachelor’s degreeinsocial sciences, public administration, political sciences, business, criminology, law, information systems, informatics, computer sciences, engineering  or an equivalentdegree in the areas mentioned.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Applications from candidates with degrees from disciplines other than the ones above may be considered if extra-curricular engagements and/or professional experience in the field of study is demonstrated.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: If you did not yet graduate your Bachelor’s but are about to soon, you can apply too. In case you are selected, you will be admitted on the condition of obtaining your Bachelor of Arts (BA.) or Bachelor of Science (BSc.) by the start of the academic year.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Given that PIONEER is completely taught in English, applicants must demonstrate proficiency in the English language and submit anEnglish proficiency test. We only accept the following language certificates:

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Please note thatno otherEnglish proficiencytest is accepted. Test results can be provided a maximum of one month after the official application deadline, but a test registration should already be uploaded onto the application form in case the applicant has not yet received their test results at the time of the application.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Students who obtained aprevious diploma(secondary or academic) in a programmetaught in English in Australia, English-speaking Canada, Ireland, New Zealand, the United Kingdom or the United States of Americacan beexempted. If you obtained your diploma in a country other than those mentioned above, you must submit one of the accepted tests, even if your studies were in English or the administrative language of the country is English.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Admission decisionsare madebased onthe evaluation ofa complete application filethat reaches the PIONEER office through the officialKU Leuven admissions tool. Applicants complete the online application form by submitting all of the following documents (in PDF):

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: ! Mind that if you are aChinese, Indian or Vietnamese applicantwith no degree other than one issued by these three countries, you need to go through an APS procedure. Given that the procedure is costly and waiting times can be significant, we do not require the APS certificate at the time of application. The PIONEER Admission Office can process your application without and grant your file a ‘conditional accept’. The condition implies that you can only officially register as a PIONEER student, provided you submit anAPS Certificatebefore the start of the new academic year. We recommend starting the procedure at least three months in advance.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: For more information, consult theKU Leuven website. Although the website only speaks of Chinese students requiring an APS Certificate, PIONEER needs Indian and Vietnamese applicants to follow the same procedure because of the more stringent German regulation applicable to our joint Erasmus Mundus programme.

project: Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
Public Sector Innovation and eGovernance
text: Although the selection requirements are the same forEEA and non-EEAapplicants, theselection procedures differ slightly. Make sure to select the selection procedure that applies to your case, as the timing of steps and communication on decisions will differ.

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text:
INTERNATIONAL MASTER IN TECHNOLOGY
AND MANAGEMENT FOR CIRCULAR ECONOMY

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: The Erasmus Mundus Joint Masters program International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy (IMATEC) is oriented on the emerging area of circular economy and bio-economy. The two-year Master multiple degree program offers high-quality vocational education, combining competencies in technology, entrepreneurship, management, planning, science, and research, all focused on circular economy.

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: Students are trained in advanced technologies for sustainable use of natural resources, life cycle assessment of these technologies, as well as management and legal and administrative aspects of the circular economy. They also gain an overview of the latest trends in research and development of new technologies.

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: Students will choose their major study track and one additional study area among (1) Technology, (2) Policy & Management, or (3) Science.

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: The graduates will be qualified for positions in technological companies (e.g. technology suppliers, consultants, or utilities), policymaking bodies (e.g. governmental agencies or NGOs), or R&D (academia or private sector). They will also acquire presentation and managerial skills, teamwork ability, work with information resources, and communication with professionals and the public.

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: Three European universities joined to form the Erasmus Mundus consortium supported by 38 associated partners representing SMEs, large companies, NGOs, and universities that play important roles in the curriculum.

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: The aim is to integrate the current study programs into a coherent study program dealing with technologies and management for the circular economy to provide an internationally attractive and topical Erasmus Mundus Joint Master (EMJM) program and to showcase European excellence in higher education.

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: The study program addresses the current transition from linear to a circular economy that will allow meeting the objectives of the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (UN SDG) and is reflected in the EU development strategies including the European Green Deal and the EU action plan for the Circular Economy.

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: THE FOUR SEMESTERS OF THE IMATEC PROGRAM WILL BE ORGANIZED AS FOLLOWS

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: The first semester encompasses basic Master’s level courses covering all specific aspects of the studies, i.e. chemical engineering, technologies for circular economy, entrepreneurship, economy and management aspects of circular economy as well as environmental policymaking. This will allow the students to obtain a fundamental background in all salient aspects of circular economy that they will use in their future studies.

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: The second and third semesters are structured into three parallel study tracks focusing on technology, policy & management, and science aspects of circular economy. The students will also attend courses aimed at transferable skills.

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: The fourth semester is devoted to the Master thesis. The students will be equally distributed among the three universities. The Master thesis topics are prepared in close collaboration between the three universities which ensures a high topicality and industrial as well as academic relevance, thus increasing the employment possibilities of the future graduates.

text: The study results of the applicants from their previous studies are evaluated based on the CGPA. The points are awarded based on the percentage of the maximum CGPA achievable to take into account the different grading scales of the applicants from different countries / universities. The points are awarded as follows:

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: Practical engineering or circular economy experience

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: The applicants can receive up to 2 points for the previous practical experience (jobs, internships, etc.) based on their CV. The points are awarded as follows:

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: The applicants can receive up to 3 points for their motivation. The strength of motivation, authenticity and convincingness are the key criteria by which the motivation letters / videos are judged by the evaluators.

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: The history and previous successes of the applicants are evaluated based on their CV. Awards received e.g. for high CGPA scores or awarded scholarships based on the study results are not considered here as they are already accounted for in the “academic success” criterion. Up to 2 points can be awarded to the applicants. The points are awarded as follows:

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: The top 50 applicants based on the sum of points received from the aforementioned criteria will be invited to participate in admission interviews. All applicants having the same final score as the applicant ranked at position number 50, will be invited to the interview, i.e. 50 is the minimum number of applicants to be invited to the admission interview. The interviews will be held online, the selected applicants will be notified about the date and time in advance.

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: The length of the admission interview is 15 minutes for each of the applicants. The applicants have first the possibility to introduce their experience and motivation within 3 minutes. After that they answer questions of the Joint Selection Committee members (the JSC consists of at least one representative from each partner, i.e. it has at least 3 members). Finally, the applicants have the possibility to ask questions. Each of the JSC members scores each of the interviewed applicants on a scale 0 – 10 points. The points awarded to each applicant are determined by discussion and agreement of all JSC members.

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: The total sum of the points obtained from the individual admission criteria and the admission interview will determine the final ranking of the applicants.

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: Applicants will be notified about the admission results by March 15 at the latest.

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: The academic year starts in September. Applicants are expected to arrive in the Czech Republic in the first week of September.

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: In the case of disagreement with the decision of the Joint Selection Committee and feeling that the Committee has not handled the applicant’s application in line with the application and selection procedures as described on this website, the applicant can appeal against the decision.

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: The applicant will need to do so within seven days of receiving the notification, by filing an Appeal Letter addressed to the Joint Selection Committee stating the reason why the applicant disagrees with the decision made and providing clear justifications. The Appeal Letter is to be sent by email tomundus@vscht.cz.

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: The appeal will be analyzed by the Joint Selection Committee and if justified, the application will be re-evaluated.

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: The applicant will be informed about the final decision within 14 days.

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: When filling in the online application, please, click on “Create a new application”, and then choose the Faculty of Environmental Technology, English, full-time, Master’s (post Bachelor), and Sustainability and Engineering  (IMATEC) (Individual Student Agreement).

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
text: It is possible to save the application and return to it later in the tab “My application”.

project: International Master in Technology and Management for Circular Economy
